alert.note: Alert for Dooly (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 4:48AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Turkey Creek at Byromville affecting Dooly County. For the Flint River Basin...including Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey Creek at Byromville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodland areas upstream and downstream from the stream gage on Georgia Highway 90. Larger portions of creek access roads will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EST Tuesday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
